Recipe.Description: Balls of mashed potatoes, stuff with crab and cream cheese, breaded and deep fried.

Prerequisites.Prerequisite: Prepare Crab Dip and chill for at least two hours.
Set up Standard Breading Method - A l'Alglaise.

Method.Step: Quarter and par-boil the potatoes in salt water.
Shock them (immerse in cold water) when done.
Shred the potatoes with a cheese grater, using the 1/4 inch openings, kinda like preparing raw potatoes for hash-browns.
Put some shredded potato in one hand and mash it out with the other, like you were making hamburgers.

Put a dollop of the crab dip in the center and then fold all of the edges up to the center. The idea is to make a ball with the dip on the inside and the potato on the outside. It's both easier and messier than it sounds -don't worry if the dip oozes out in places, we'll fix that in the next step, and/or you can patch holes with bits of potato. Keep in mind that the more you work them and roll them, the stickier they get and the better they bind together -but don't work them so much that you end up mixing the dip and potato completely.
Roll the ball in the beaten egg, coat it completely, then roll it in the bread crumbs. Set it on a plate with a thin layer of bread crumbs.
Fry in batches until golden brown.
